intro: Minuartia erythrosepala var. erythrosepala, commonly known as the red-flowered rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage on rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or red in color, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a fine, white or grayish coating, known as a powdery bloom. This species is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
